contentrichtext.text: {{refimprove|date=January 2013}} {{Other uses}} {{Infobox Weapon |name=Rooikat |image=[[File:South Africa Rooikat.jpg|300px]] |caption=Rooikat 105 |origin=[[South Africa]] |type=[[Armoured fighting vehicle]] |design_date= 1976 |production_date= 1989 – present |service= 1990 – present |is_vehicle=yes |crew=4 |length={{convert|7.1|m|ftin|abbr=on}}<br>{{convert|8.2|m|ftin|abbr=on}} with gun forward |width={{convert|2.9|m|ftin|abbr=on}} |height={{convert|2.6|m|ftin|abbr=on}} turret roof |weight= 28 [[tonne|t]] |armour= |primary_armament= 1 x [[Denel GT4]] 76mm 62-calibre rifled gun, firing an [[Kinetic energy penetrator|APFSDS round]]<br>Muzzle velocity: > 1600m/s.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.army.mil.za/equipment/weaponsystems/armour/rooikat_equipm.htm|title=Rooikat|publisher=[[South African Army]]|accessdate=2009-06-26}}</ref><ref name="defenceweb">{{cite web|url=http://www.defenceweb.co.za/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=496&Itemid=362|title=Rooikat armoured car|publisher=DefenceWeb|accessdate=2009-06-26}}</ref> |secondary_armament= 2 x [[M1919A4#International_variants_and_derivatives|MG4]] 7.62 mm machine guns; 8 x 81 mm smoke grenade dischargers<ref name="defenceweb"/> |engine= 10-cylinder water-cooled diesel |engine_power= 414 KW (563 hp) |suspension=8×8 wheeled, Fully independent active trailing arm |speed=Road: 120 km/h (75 mph)<br> Off-road: 50 km/h (31 mph) |pw_ratio= 14.89kW/t |vehicle_range= 1000 km (621 mi) }} The '''Rooikat''' ([[Afrikaans]] for "[[Caracal]]"; literally "Red cat") is a wheeled [[armoured fighting vehicle]] built in [[South Africa]] for the [[South African Army]]. It was designed for combat reconnaissance and seek and destroy operations. Its secondary roles include combat support, anti-armour and anti-guerrilla operations. The Rooikat is intended for deep penetration missions, so the wheeled design was needed for speed and to counter sandy desert conditions that might slow tracked vehicles. ==Production history== Designed to replace the [[Eland Mk7|Eland]] the Rooikat came too late for the [[Angolan Civil War|war in Angola]]. It was designed to incorporate lessons learned from the bush war.{{Citation needed|date=December 2007}} One was turned into a conventional vehicle electric drive technology demonstrator (CVED) and displayed at AAD2006 in Cape Town in September of that year. The CVED project involved LMT, HIT, IAD, Nezrotek, Hotchinson (France), Kessler Magnet Motor (Germany) and MTU (Germany). VEG Magazine reported in 2006 the vehicle was fitted with a power supply control system feeding eight wheel-hub mounted M67/0 electric units and a two-phase pneumatic gearbox. ==Capability== * Can climb a 1m earth vertical step. * Can cross a 2m wide trench at a crawl 1m @ 60 km/h. * Can ford water 1,5m deep. * Can climb a gradient of 70 degrees. * Can traverse a gradient of 30 degrees. ==Variants== *Rooikat 76: [[Denel GT4]] 76 mm gun *Rooikat 105: [[Denel GT7]] 105 mm gun ==Operators== :{{flag|South Africa}}: [[South African National Defence Force]].<ref>http://www.army.mil.za/equipment/weaponsystems/armour/rooikat_equipm.htm</ref> == References == {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.baesystems.com/ProductsServices/bae_prod_landa_rooikat.html Manufacturer's website] (Accessed 28 July 2008) * [http://www.defenceweb.co.za/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=496&Itemid=362 Factfile on Vehicle] (Accessed 25 February 2009) * [http://www.army-technology.com/projects/rooikat/ Rooikat 105 Wheeled Armoured Fighting Vehicles] * [http://www.denellandsystems.co.za/products_rooikat_76_full_description.html Rooikat 76 Armoured Fighting Vehicle] {{Denel}} {{Armoured combat vehicles}} [[Category:Armoured cars]] [[Category:Military vehicles 1990–1999]] [[Category:Armoured fighting vehicles of the post–Cold War period]] [[Category:Armoured fighting vehicles of South Africa]] [[Category:Denel]]
